metadata.degraded_mode_warning: CANON_INVENTORY.json contains placeholder/truncated hashes for PUBLIC_API artifacts. Per CANON_INVENTORY_INTEGRITY_REQUIREMENTS.md Section 4, alignment operates in DEGRADED mode. Consumer repos must be notified and governance change request escalated to CS2.

requirements.statement: MUST maintain governance/CANON_INVENTORY.json with full sha256 hashes (no placeholders) for all PUBLIC_API artifacts.
requirements.validation_hook: jq -e '.canons[] | select(.layer_down_status=="PUBLIC_API") | select(.file_hash=="placeholder" or (.file_hash|type=="string" and (.|length)<16))' governance/CANON_INVENTORY.json should return empty

requirements.statement: Every CANON_INVENTORY.json entry MUST record canonical commit SHA and canon effective date.
requirements.validation_hook: jq -e '.canons[] | select(.effective_date == null or .effective_date == "")' governance/CANON_INVENTORY.json should return empty

requirements.statement: Constitutional canon semantic changes require CS2 approval; liaison may only correct syntax errors.
requirements.validation_hook: PR description must contain CS2 approval reference for constitutional canon changes

requirements.statement: All constitutional canon MUST include explicit version in document header.
requirements.validation_hook: grep -L "^\*\*Version\*\*:" governance/canon/*_CANON.md should return empty

requirements.statement: MUST NOT modify BUILD_PHILOSOPHY.md, FM_ROLE_CANON.md, WAVE_MODEL.md, LIVING_AGENT_SYSTEM.md, GOVERNANCE_PURPOSE_AND_SCOPE.md without CS2 approval.
requirements.validation_hook: Protected file change detection in PR diff with CS2 approval verification

requirements.statement: Governance evidence artifacts (Type 5) are immutable after generation; create new file for re-validation.
requirements.validation_hook: Git history check for modifications to existing evidence files

requirements.statement: All evidence files MUST contain Date, Author, and required schema fields.
requirements.validation_hook: grep -L "Date:" governance/evidence/*.md && grep -L "Author:" governance/evidence/*.md

requirements.statement: MUST create session memory in .agent-workspace/governance-repo-administrator/memory/ with structured format per LIVING_AGENT_SYSTEM.md.
requirements.validation_hook: Existence check for memory/session-*.md with required sections

requirements.statement: Maintain rolling 5-session memory window; archive older sessions to .archive/ with monthly summaries.
requirements.validation_hook: ls -1 .agent-workspace/governance-repo-administrator/memory/session-*.md | wc -l should be ≤ 5

requirements.statement: All governance changes MUST maintain git history audit trail; never force-push or rewrite history.
requirements.validation_hook: Git reflog check for force-push or rebase operations

requirements.statement: Changes to constitutional canon MUST trigger governance ripple (layer-down) to all consumer repos.
requirements.validation_hook: Ripple execution log in governance/ripple/ for constitutional changes

requirements.statement: MUST update GOVERNANCE_ARTIFACT_INVENTORY.md and CANON_INVENTORY.json when canon created/modified/removed.
requirements.validation_hook: git diff --name-status | grep "governance/canon/" | wc -l vs git diff governance/CANON_INVENTORY.json | wc -l correlation

requirements.statement: Ripple log entries MUST be created atomically with issue creation, including issue numbers, timestamps, and status.
requirements.validation_hook: Ripple log timestamp correlation with GitHub issue creation timestamp

requirements.statement: MUST process layer-up issues from consumer repos, validate evidence, classify severity (CRITICAL/HIGH/MEDIUM/LOW), and draft governance changes.
requirements.validation_hook: Layer-up issue label and processing documentation in governance PR

requirements.statement: MUST scan consumer repositories for drift and pending layer-up issues BEFORE making new canon changes.
requirements.validation_hook: Scan evidence artifact in PR description for canon change PRs

requirements.statement: MUST maintain CONSUMER_REPO_REGISTRY.json as deterministic source of truth for ripple targeting.
requirements.validation_hook: jq empty governance/CONSUMER_REPO_REGISTRY.json syntax validation

requirements.statement: Governance repo MUST expose standardized merge gate interface with exact contexts: 'Merge Gate Interface / merge-gate/verdict', 'Merge Gate Interface / governance/alignment', 'Merge Gate Interface / stop-and-fix/enforcement'.
requirements.validation_hook: .github/workflows/ contains workflow named "Merge Gate Interface" with three specified jobs

requirements.statement: merge-gate/verdict MUST validate committed evidence artifacts exist, conform to schema, and contain no test-dodging language.
requirements.validation_hook: Verdict gate workflow validates .agent-admin/prehandover/, .agent-admin/gates/, .agent-admin/rca/

requirements.statement: MUST maintain governance/GATE_REQUIREMENTS_INDEX.json as machine-readable requirements source for verdict gate runtime loading.
requirements.validation_hook: jq empty governance/GATE_REQUIREMENTS_INDEX.json syntax validation

requirements.statement: governance/alignment gate MUST verify canonical governance alignment via sha256 comparison and fail if drift detected.
requirements.validation_hook: Alignment gate workflow performs hash comparison against CANON_INVENTORY.json

requirements.statement: stop-and-fix/enforcement gate MUST fail if stop-and-fix condition unresolved and require RCA artifact.
requirements.validation_hook: Stop-and-fix gate validates RCA artifact presence when triggered

requirements.statement: MAY self-align syntax corrections, cross-reference repairs, inventory updates, documentation clarity, runbook improvements, and organizational changes without CS2 approval.
requirements.validation_hook: PR description documents self-alignment rationale and authority reference

requirements.statement: MUST escalate to CS2 for constitutional canon semantic changes, agent contract modifications, protected governance changes, authority boundary conflicts, and protected file modifications.
requirements.validation_hook: Escalation document in .agent-workspace/governance-repo-administrator/escalation-inbox/ or CS2 approval in PR

requirements.statement: When escalating, MUST create escalation document in .agent-workspace/<agent-id>/escalation-inbox/ with context, decision point, options, recommendation, impact, and request sections.
requirements.validation_hook: Escalation document structure validation against template

requirements.statement: For boundary-case decisions (non-canonical governance doc refinements, simple governance script fixes), MUST document rationale in PR description.
requirements.validation_hook: PR description contains rationale section for boundary decisions

requirements.statement: MUST execute .github/scripts/wake-up-protocol.sh at session start to load identity, memory, governance, environment health, and generate working contract.
requirements.validation_hook: environment-health.json timestamp within session start window

requirements.statement: MUST validate all JSON (jq empty), YAML (yamllint), and Markdown (markdownlint) files before merge.
requirements.validation_hook: CI workflow executes syntax validation steps

requirements.statement: MUST validate all file references and governance document cross-references are resolvable.
requirements.validation_hook: Cross-reference validation script execution in CI

requirements.statement: MUST ensure GOVERNANCE_ARTIFACT_INVENTORY.md reflects all governance artifacts; detect phantom entries and untracked files.
requirements.validation_hook: Inventory diff review with no discrepancies

requirements.statement: Governance scripts (Type 3) MUST have unit tests, integration tests, dry-run mode, error handling, idempotency, and logging.
requirements.validation_hook: Script test execution in CI with pass/fail report

requirements.statement: MUST execute .github/scripts/session-closure.sh to create session memory, rotate old memories, capture lessons, create escalations, update environment health, and verify safe state.
requirements.validation_hook: Session memory file created post-session with all required sections

requirements.statement: MUST generate session-specific working-contract.md from agent identity, last 5 memories, current governance bindings, environment state, big-picture context, and personal lessons.
requirements.validation_hook: working-contract.md exists with timestamp matching session start

requirements.statement: MUST name workflow 'Merge Gate Interface' (exact) with jobs 'merge-gate/verdict', 'governance/alignment', 'stop-and-fix/enforcement' (exact).
requirements.validation_hook: yq '.name' .github/workflows/merge-gate-interface.yml == "Merge Gate Interface"

requirements.statement: Merge gate workflow MUST trigger on pull_request event; on: push is optional and may not replace PR trigger.
requirements.validation_hook: yq '.on | has("pull_request")' .github/workflows/merge-gate-interface.yml == true

requirements.statement: PR classification MUST be deterministic based on changed paths, labels, and branch patterns (label override → governance → docs-only → code).
requirements.validation_hook: Classification logic code review in verdict gate job

requirements.statement: Branch protection MUST require only the three standard contexts; no repo-specific checks as required.
requirements.validation_hook: GitHub branch protection settings API check

requirements.statement: Gate failures MUST produce short, evidence-first error messages; prohibited: log archaeology, manual inspection requirements, narrative-only claims.
requirements.validation_hook: Gate failure message format validation in workflow output

requirements.statement: All governance changes MUST be recorded in governance/CHANGELOG.md with version, date, type, description, affected artifacts, migration guidance, approval authority, effective date.
requirements.validation_hook: CHANGELOG.md updated in PR diff for governance changes

requirements.statement: MUST track which repos received layer-down, when propagation occurred, validation status, completion status, inventory update status, coverage percentage, and ripple log entries.
requirements.validation_hook: Ripple tracking artifact in governance/ripple/ with completion metrics

requirements.statement: MUST log both layer-up (app→canon) and layer-down (canon→app) ripple flows with issue numbers, timestamps, and status.
requirements.validation_hook: Ripple log format validation against specified structure

requirements.statement: For governance changes, MUST include impact analysis covering affected repositories, agents, gates, schemas, migration effort, and risk assessment.
requirements.validation_hook: Impact analysis section in PR description or linked artifact

requirements.statement: MUST archive upward learning with original failure/learning records, promotion decision rationale, resulting governance changes, impact assessment, effectiveness validation.
requirements.validation_hook: Learning archive structure in governance/memory/canonical-lessons/

requirements.statement: MUST use MATURION_BOT_TOKEN secret for all automated actions; token MUST be fine-grained with least privilege (Contents: RW, PRs: RW, Issues: RW).
requirements.validation_hook: Workflow uses secrets.MATURION_BOT_TOKEN and never pushes to main directly

requirements.statement: MUST detect and block unauthorized changes to .github/workflows/, constitutional canon, agent contracts without CS2 approval.
requirements.validation_hook: Protected file change detection workflow with approval gate

requirements.statement: MUST NOT push directly to main branch; all writes occur via PR branches.
requirements.validation_hook: Branch protection enforcement and bot workflow validation

requirements.statement: When placeholder hashes detected in CANON_INVENTORY.json for PUBLIC_API artifacts, MUST mark alignment as DEGRADED, block merge gates, create CS2 escalation issue.
requirements.validation_hook: Alignment gate detects placeholders and fails with escalation artifact

requirements.statement: MUST implement token rotation policy with defined frequency and incident response; scheduled fallback alignment continues during token failure.
requirements.validation_hook: Token rotation documentation and incident response runbook existence

requirements.statement: MUST execute governance gap analysis scan during wake-up protocol and session work; auto-remediate known patterns, escalate novel gaps.
requirements.validation_hook: Gap analysis artifact in session evidence

requirements.statement: When encountering conflicting governance directives, unclear authority boundaries, or missing governance coverage, MUST escalate to CS2 with structured escalation document.
requirements.validation_hook: Escalation document creation for ambiguity cases

requirements.statement: Upward ripple proposals MUST use schema at governance/schemas/GOVERNANCE_CHANGE_PROPOSAL.schema.md with trigger, evidence, proposal, impact, affected repos, migration plan, rationale.
requirements.validation_hook: Layer-up issue conforms to governance change proposal schema

requirements.statement: For high-impact changes with uncertainty or precedent-setting decisions, MUST document decision rationale and escalate to CS2 for strategic judgment.
requirements.validation_hook: Decision rationale in PR description or escalation document

exclusions.note: All references to .github/agents/ agent contract files and non-canon sources excluded per directive
